pros: My supervisor and the Instructional Designer were very friendly and helpful.
cons: There were no downsides when I worked at Saint Rose.

pros: Nice people, includes good vacation
cons: Overworked and underpaid No raises

pros: Excellent benefits, good PTO, good environment
cons: Too low pay, poor management

review_title: Mixed priorities create tenuous and chaotic work environment
pros: Ability to work with and guide student success
cons:
constantly shifting institutional priorities towards a smattering of professional degrees 
Reduced emphasis on providing good, quality, holistic education
Violation of tenure laws
Poor fiscal management
Very low pay

pros: Learned lots of new skills!
cons: No one that I can think of.

pros: Committed smart colleagues and nice students
cons: Financially mismanaged, huge turnover, no support for either developing teaching or research; admission standards spiraling the drain. A very discouraging place to work. They’ve fired about half of their regular faculty and replaced them with low-paid temps. No raises for eight years and counting. Wages in bottom 20% nationally, but senior salaries very comfortable . Where research agendas go to die.

job_title: Adjunct Faculty Member in Albany, NY
pros: Provost McLane is excellent and supportive
cons: College is going through financial challenges, similar to many small residential colleges

pros: great students and affordable to live
cons: administrative nightmare and financial problems

job_title: Assistant Director of First-Year Experience in Albany, NY
pros: Great colleagues, Nice campus, and decent benefits
cons: Declining budget and added roles

job_title: Will Not Disclose For Fear Of Retaliation in Albany, NY
pros: Good stepping stone job. A few caring people left to keep the place going.
cons: Complete mismanagement on behalf of the AVPs and VPs. Place is a giant black hole if you care about your job.

pros: Academia is a great field to work in
cons: Small colleges are struggling financially right now

job_title: Visiting Assistant Professor in Albany, NY
pros: small community with good students
cons: large-scale financial mismanagement by board

pros: Great Staff in the office
cons: Very low pay for the area

pros: Students are wonderful, many colleagues are supportive, school is in a vibrant part of town, nice campus
cons: The administration send out monthly emails praising their own accomplishments with hardly any mention of faculty and staff, many of whom are killing themselves to compensate for faculty and staff cuts. Administration is scolding and disrespectful in the way they speak about faculty. Students are being sold lies, as there has been scant transparency with students and parents about the impact of faculty cuts on their education. Benefits have been horribly slashed- little to no professional development, poor medical benefits policy, no employer contribution to retirement. Faculty, please take note- your work is valuable and your interests should be represented. Mobilize! Prospective faculty, especially those early in career, look elsewhere until/ unless things stabilize and improve.

pros: The faculty, lower level staff, and students are amazing.
cons: The college is becoming a corporation. The top administrators are amassing huge salaries and bonuses while they are cutting staff and faculty jobs, benefits, and health insurance. The administration is bloated and getting bigger. They keep hiring top administrators who are incompetent - can't raise money, can't recruit more students, can't expand research budgets, make terrible financial decisions, etc. etc. The faculty and lower level staff are the heart of the institution. It's a college! Faculty and teaching are the main focus, and the lower level staff also interact with the students the most. Yet, the administration shows no concern for the faculty or lower level staff.  They only reward themselves. They are not working for the faculty and staff, but only to increase their own salaries and their power at the institution.

review_title: President and Board Destroying Fine Institution
pros: Great students, hard work and caring staff, committed and talented faculty, nice campus, great traditions of community that are sadly being destroyed by the current leadership.
cons: Poor salaries, awful benefits, no respect for staff or faculty, corporate mentality on the part of administration that leads to valuing marketing and profit over student development and meaningful education.

pros: Great flexibility and accommodations for family work balance.
cons: Severe issues- organizational structure, morale, leadership, and professional development.

job_title: Supply Chain, Technical and Operation Manager in New York, NY
pros: After 25 Years working experience with Nestle S.A as operations manager, I am taking an MBA Class at the college of Saint Rose to enhance my managerial skills, Business wide overview , outlook and and financial business management
cons: It is hard to be back to school after 25 years, but it is a matter of target and change management

pros: Working at a college, the students keep you on your toes and busy!  Vibrant working environment.  Students attending Saint Rose are not there to become millionaires, they're there to make a difference in the world.  This attitude spills over to the employees that deal with them on a daily basis.
cons: Saint Rose is currently going through a rough time,  financially.  This can make for difficult decisions.

pros:
pay was what it was 
insurance is good
location in the heart of albany 
vibrant buildings
concerts at the Massry Center are of top quality
cons:
unfair labor practices 
top-heavy administration 
president is in over her head, much to the college's peril 
little or no feedback on performance
technology is behind the times 
climate of frustration and stress leads to poor health 
key areas are short staffed 
no raises for hard work
only going to get worse as more good employees either retire or quit due to poor working conditions
many coworkers are stressed out and have attitude problems

pros: Decent pay, good benefits, some staff are friendly
cons: Working for the Institutional Advancement was a disaster for me. I wasn't qualified for the role I was hired for and was treated horribly by upper management for not having amazing fundraising ideas right off the bat. Training and support was promised during the interview process and none was given.

pros: They offer tuition remission and couple of other benefits that are nice, like riding the CDTA buses for free with your ID. I liked snow days as an adult. I have heard the benefits are declining though, so there may be no positives now.
cons: If you enjoy being treated like you are stupid and incompetent, the IA department is a great place to be. It is highly nepotistic, full of cliques that gossip and stab others in the back. The managers are horrible; they treat you so badly but expect the world. If you look at someone wrong in a meeting, you will get reprimanded for it later. Therefore, all of the good, honest employees leave because they got treated like garbage. The pay is not even livable, unless you are in upper management; then you'll be grossly overpaid for doing nothing. I left for a great, low stress job that pays $20,000 more than I made there. Saint Rose IA is a tense, stressful, horrible environment that is condoned by the team management. The ones making the most money aren't even capable of doing their own jobs, yet find it perfectly acceptable to treat you badly when you are actually doing what you were hired for. It is sad to me; I was very much looking forward to working here, only to find out that it would be the worst working environment I could have imagined.

pros: Used to be a very community-style atmosphere. Past and new administrators have drove the college into a $9,000,000/year deficit.
cons: The yearly deficit have led to several faculty, administrator, and staff layoffs, and will likely lead to more.

pros: The community between administration and faculty was a healthy environment.  Working in IT we were able to work with the best tools to get the job done.  The Director and staff in IT were great.
cons: Although we worked with the best gear...it usually meant that we had less personnel to work along side.

pros:
* Small class sizes
* Minimal supervision of adjuncts -- a lot of leeway to develop courses/structure classes
* Strong student organization presence, active campus/students
cons:
* Pay/benefits for adjuncts could be better
* Could involve adjuncts in committees/incorporate into planning a bit more

pros: The staff people and the faculty are great.
cons: The salary, no raise in years, health care costs doubled and now you have to pay tuition for classes.

pros: It was a pleasure to work in such a nice area of Albany, NY.
cons: I believe the financial situation of the college is in jeopardy. The lack of online courses for continuing adults with full-time careers is lacking and has been detrimental to the overall institution.

pros: good benefits and good working schedule
cons: departments tend to work in silos.  Sometimes difficult to work with collages

pros: Benefits were adequate, experience was meaningful and resume-building, some colleagues were very warm and kind.
cons: Goals were constantly changing, as were administrators and procedures, petty, gossiping, alliances made and switched, Truly bizarre and stressful work environment. Glad I had the experience;  made me appreciate former bosses and made me much stronger emotionally and far less trusting and naive.

pros: Very good college with some good courses and experienced faculty.
cons: Need to change the course curriculum by adding some new technical courses and removing the old technical courses.

review_title: Excellent colleagues, good students, nice work environment.
pros: Benefits, colleagues, work-life balance, culture, leadership is improving.
cons: Somewhat lower salaries than other colleges.

pros:
Great atmosphere-the landscaping is royal
Hard work
Savvy staff
cons:
Apolitical--it seems the students hardly read the newspapers
Too "soft"
In the box

review_title: Tenure is meaningless at St. Rose
pros: Albany is a nice city.
cons: The fact that President Stefanco eliminated 23 professors who were either tenure track or tenured pretty much makes tenure meaningless because she'll just throw out your contract and make you fight with an attorney to get any amount of recompense.

pros: There were flexible hours for students.
cons: The program got cut and then brought back

pros: Worked for alongside great people. Enjoyed job.
cons: Losing job due to budget cuts

job_title: Assistant Director of Admissions in Albany, NY
pros: Interacting and impacting students and families lives.
cons: Pay wage isn't the best.
